com.mostc.pftt.host
Class AHost

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.pftt.host.Host
      com.mostc.pftt.host.AHost
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalHost, RemoteHost
public abstract class AHost
extends Host

Abstracts host management so client code doesn't need to care if host is local or remote(ssh).

Author:
Matt Ficken
See Also:
exec(com.mostc.pftt.results.ConsoleManager, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map, byte[], java.nio.charset.Charset, java.lang.String), #test_cmd, Host.DEV, Host.isRemote(), readFile(java.lang.String), #saveText, getSystemDrive(), Host.isWindows(), #join, Host.dirSeparator()

 ExecOutput cmdOut(java.lang.String cmd, int timeout_sec)
          on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe Also, on Windows, if you want to execute a group of programs (ex: "A.exe && B.exe") you must use #cmd If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD.

public java.lang.String getOSName()
returns the name of the Host operating system. cleans up the name and returns it in a short standard form with CPU architecture and service pack, for example: Win 7 SP1 x64

public abstract java.lang.String getContentsDetectCharset(java.lang.String file,
                                                          CharsetDeciderDecoder cdd)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
gets the contents of the file as single unicode string, automatically detecting the character set and converting the bytes to a string (supports exotic charsets like EUC-CN or SHIFT_JS). Note: this takes extra time, often most files can be read with just #getContents because they don't use exotic charsets

Parameters:
file -
cdd -
Returns:
Throws:

execOut

public abstract ExecOutput execOut(java.lang.String cmd,
                                   int timeout_sec,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> object,
                                   byte[] stdin_post,
                                   java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                   java.lang.String current_dir)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
executes the given program

Parameters:
cmd - - program to run
timeout_sec - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
env - - map of environment variables to use
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
current_dir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Host.FOUR_HOURS

cmdOut

public ExecOutput cmdOut(java.lang.String cmd,
                         int timeout_sec)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe Also, on Windows, if you want to execute a group of programs (ex: "A.exe && B.exe") you must use #cmd If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD. If this is linux, it just passes the command to #exec

Parameters:
cmd -
timeout_sec -
env -
stdin_data -
charset -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:

getLocalhostListenAddress

public java.lang.String getLocalhostListenAddress()
servers running on Windows won't accept sockets from localhost to 127.0.0.1|localhost. instead have to use the ip address of one of its network interfaces (Windows doesn't have a Loopback(LO) network device)

Returns:

exec

public boolean exec(ConsoleManager cm,
                    java.lang.String ctx_str,
                    java.lang.String cmd,
                    int timeout_sec,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                    byte[] stdin_post,
                    java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                    java.lang.String current_dir)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: Host
executes the given program

Specified by:
exec in class Host
cmd - - program to run
timeout_sec - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
env - - map of environment variables to use
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
current_dir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Host.FOUR_HOURS

isWindowsServer

public boolean isWindowsServer()
returns TRUE if host is a Windows Server (2008, 2008r2, 2012) or FALSE if its not (Windows Vista, 7, 8, Linux, BSD, etc...)
